relations.target: fist=05572697-n (a hand with the fingers clenched in the palm (as for hitting))

thumb=03872399-n (a convex molding having a cross section in the form of a quarter of a circle or of an ellipse);04438030-n (the part of a glove that provides a covering for the thumb);05574850-n (the thick short innermost digit of the forelimb);01212517-v (feel or handle with the fingers; \""finger the binding of the book\"");01960814-v (travel by getting free rides from motorists);02157453-v (look through a book or other written material; \""He thumbed through the report\""; \""She leafed through the volume\""

okay=06700446-n (an endorsement; \""they gave us the O.K. to go ahead\"");02088253-a (being satisfactory or in satisfactory condition; \""an all-right movie\""; \""the passengers were shaken up but are all right\""; \""is everything all right?\""; \""everything's fine\""; \""things are okay\""; \""dinner and the movies had been fine\""; \""another minute I'd have been fine\"");00808164-v (give sanction to; \""I approve of his educational policies\"");00015933-r (in a satisfactory or adequate manner; \""she'll do okay on her own\""; \""held up all right under pressure\""; (`alright' is a nonstandard variant of `all right')
approve=00675902-v (judge to be right or commendable; think well of);00808164-v (give sanction to; \""I approve of his educational policies\""

gesture=00335335-n (motion of hands or body to emphasize or help to express a thought or feeling);01230869-n (something done as an indication of intention; \""a political gesture\""; \""a gesture of defiance\"");06889359-n (the use of movements (especially of the hands) to communicate familiar or prearranged signals);00994073-v (show, express or direct through movement; \""He gestured his desire to leave\""

senses.definition: A gesture signifying approval or okay; a thumb pointing up out of a fist.
